resources.string: Parrot Japanese application is designed for the beginners and the speaking-oriented Japanese learners or who need to be familiar with Japanese in a very short time. It is useful to use this app as a small dictionary. For the beginners, following guidance to help using this app effectively:

string-array.name: st_steps
string-array.item: Learn vocabulary: Essential vocabulary and Count numbers

string-array.name: st_targets
string-array.item: First step for you familiar with basic Japanese sounds and characters. You will remember them automatically when you go through other steps. So you should not waste weeks or a month to remember all of them before going to next steps.
Take a few days or a week to take a look on all words once. You will come back here many times when necessary.
Video series made by Japanese native speaker to help you learn simple Japanese grammar. These videos teach you to speak a sentence from very simple to complicated.
Common use phrases which are not in grammar videos
Learn more vocabulary, grammar, listening and writing skills from recommended resources

string-array.name: res_desc
string-array.item: Japanesepod101 has a lot of audios, videos along with transcipt, vocabulary, exercises ... for different level learners
Erin is a anime character who help you learn Japanese through diffrent situations. You will learn grammar and vocabulary with each situation.
This guide to Japanese is one of the most well known on the internet.
Most popular video sharing site. You can find a lot of stuffs here for learning Japanese: music, films, anime, cartoon ...
Learning vocabulary website. After a specific time, this site will check your memory and it reminds you the forgot words.
Lang-8 is a language exchange social network. You can write journal entries in Japanese and a Japanese native speaker will correct them for you.
ReadTheKanji quizzes you on kanji inside of actual Japanese sentences. You have to read those kanji in different contexts.
